title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.2: DEMAND FOR QUALITY MNCH, IYCF AND HYGIENE INTERVENTIONS

description.narrative: Output 1.2: By 2023, parents and caregivers have increased capacity to practice and demand quality MNCH, infant and young child feeding (IYCF) and hygiene interventions

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.2: By 2023, parents and caregivers have increased capacity to practice and demand quality MNCH, infant and young child feeding (IYCF) and hygiene interventions

description.narrative: UNICEF provided technical and financial support to the Nutrition and WASH sectors to effectively respond to impacts of the 2019-2020 El Nino drought and the global COVID-19 epidemic. UNICEF procured therapeutic nutrition commodities aimed at reaching 8500 children and women; supported training of 462 community health workers and leaders on nutrition, hygiene and COVID-19 awareness who have in turn reached over 70,000 people; rehabilitated 7 water supply systems benefiting over 5,277 people, supported water trucking to health care facilities benefiting 93,202 people and continued strengthening sector enabling environments (coordination, resource mobilization and capacity building) for effective service delivery. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Percentage of districts implementing plans/programmes to improve the diversity of diets in children
UNICEF-targeted population in humanitarian situations accessing sufficient quantity of water of appropriate quality for drinking, cooking and personal hygiene
Number of schools equipped with appropriate and functioning hand-washing facilities
Number of schools benefiting from improved WASH services from UNICEF's direct support
Number of primary caregivers of children aged 0-23 months who received counselling on IYCF in UNICEF supported districts
Number of people drought affected areas reached with information to change their hygiene and household water storage and treatment practices
